_header: O my heart and O my heart
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1218.
_description: ‘My hart it is so sore’, attributed to Henry VIII — one quatrain

BLAdd31922.Transcription: O my hart & o my hartit is so soresens I must nedys from my loue departand know no cause wherfore
BLAdd31922.Note: Words repeated with music twice more for two further singing parts.

HunRB69798.Transcription:
O my hart and O my hart my hart that ys so soresytt thatt I most
                    frome my loue depart& know no cause where ffore
HunRB69798.Note: Added by a hand of c. 1500; immediately followed by 6551.
